question: Which country's cultural heritage is "Adinkra Symbols"?
explanation: Adinkra is symbols from Ghana that represent concepts or aphorisms. Adinkra is used extensively in fabrics, logos and pottery. They are incorporated into walls and other architectural features. Fabric adinkra is woodcut sign writing as well as screen printing. Adinkra symbols appear on some traditional Akan goldweights. The symbols are also carved on stools for domestic and ritual use. Tourism has led to new departures in the use of the symbols in such items as T-shirts and jewellery.
